competitors.name: WooCommerce
competitors.notes: WordPress plugin with largest e-commerce platform percentage, excellent for WordPress experts prioritizing SEO

competitors.name: BigCommerce
competitors.notes: Main SaaS competitor - Standard $39/mo, Plus $105/mo, Pro $399/mo, Enterprise custom. No transaction fees, unlimited products/staff, cloud-native architecture for scale

competitors.name: Adobe Commerce (Magento)
competitors.notes: Most dynamic platform for larger enterprises. Open Source free (requires hosting), Adobe Commerce Cloud starts at $40K/year. Full customization and advanced features

competitors.name: Salesforce Commerce Cloud
competitors.notes: Direct competitor for enterprise e-commerce needs

competitors.name: Wix
competitors.notes: Major indirect competitor with AI-driven personalization, ease-of-use focus

competitors.name: Squarespace
competitors.notes: Indirect competitor, strong design focus with e-commerce capabilities

competitors.name: Webflow
competitors.notes: Advanced SEO controls, customizable URLs, auto-generated schema, full page-level markup without plugins

competitors.name: Ecwid
competitors.notes: One of four biggest Shopify competitors, adds e-commerce to existing sites

competitors.name: Volusion
competitors.notes: Ease-of-use friendly alternative for small businesses

competitors.name: Weebly
competitors.notes: Simple website builder with e-commerce features

competitors.name: PrestaShop
competitors.notes: Free/low-cost alternative with flexibility and customization

context: Shopify maintains leadership position with 29% US market share and 4.4-star rating. Global e-commerce revenue projected to reach $4.32T by end of 2025. Key trends: cloud-native architecture for scalability (BigCommerce, Adobe Commerce), core SEO capabilities (Webflow, WooCommerce), AI-driven personalization (Wix, Adobe Commerce). Shopify remains best choice for most companies due to ease of use, performance, scalability, and ecosystem.
